item.title: Liz add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "I'm going to smile, and my smile will sink down into your pupils, and heaven knows what it will become." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Liz add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you as certain dark things are to be loved, in secret, between the shadow and the soul." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Liz add a quote by Jean de La Bruyère
item.description: "Those who make the worst use of their time are the first to complain of its brevity." -- Jean de La Bruyère

item.title: Liz add a quote by Martin Amis
item.description: "Love is an abstract noun, something nebulous. And yet love turns out to be the only part of us that is solid, as the world turns upside down and the screen goes black." -- Martin Amis

item.title: Liz add a quote by Gene Stratton-Porter
item.description: "If you are lazy, and accept your lot, you may live in it. If you are willing to work, you can write your name anywhere you choose." -- Gene Stratton-Porter

item.title: Liz add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies, said Jojen. The man who never reads lives only one." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Liz add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "You never really understand a person until you consider things from his point of view... Until you climb inside of his skin and walk around in it." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Liz add a quote by Henry Ford
item.description: "Whether you think you can, or you think you can't--you're right." -- Henry Ford

item.title: Liz add a quote by William Arthur Ward
item.description: "The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails." -- William Arthur Ward

item.title: Liz add a quote by Dale Carnegie
item.description: "It isn't what you have or who you are or where you are or what you are doing that makes you happy or unhappy. It is what you think about it." -- Dale Carnegie

item.title: Liz add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "Grammar is a piano I play by ear." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Liz add a quote by Willa Cather
item.description: "The world is little, people are little, human life is little. There is only one big thing — desire." -- Willa Cather

item.title: Liz add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Some day you will be old enough to start reading fairy tales again." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Liz add a quote by John Greenleaf Whittier
item.description: "The windows of my soul I throw Wide open to the sun." -- John Greenleaf Whittier

item.title: Liz add a quote by Douglas Coupland
item.description: "Remember: the time you feel lonely is the time you most need to be by yourself. Life's cruelest irony." -- Douglas Coupland

item.title: Liz add a quote by Carl Sandburg
item.description: "Time is the coin of your life. You spend it. Do not allow others to spend it for you." -- Carl Sandburg

item.title: Liz add a quote by Muriel Spark
item.description: "To me education is a leading out of what is already there in the pupil's soul." -- Muriel Spark

item.title: Liz add a quote by Gertrude Stein
item.description: "We are always the same age inside. " -- Gertrude Stein

item.title: Liz add a quote by Cynthia Ozick
item.description: "We often take for granted the very things that most deserve our gratitude." -- Cynthia Ozick

item.title: Liz add a quote by Richard P. Feynman
item.description: "Nobody ever figures out what life is all about, and it doesn't matter. Explore the world. Nearly everything is really interesting if you go into it deeply enough." -- Richard P. Feynman

item.title: Liz add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "To love another person is to see the face of God." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Liz add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "By the pricking of my thumbs, Something wicked this way comes." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Liz add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "And I asked myself about the present: how wide it was, how deep it was, how much was mine to keep." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Liz add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Be steady and well-ordered in your life so that you can be fierce and original in your work." -- Gustave Flaubert
